ZMK_WSL.name: ZMK_WSL
ZMK_WSL.description: Zeroizable Master Key Write Soft Lock When set, prevents any writes (software and hardware) to the ZMK registers and the ZMK_HWP, ZMK_VAL, and ZMK_ECC_EN fields of the LPMKCR

ZMK_RSL.name: ZMK_RSL
ZMK_RSL.description: Zeroizable Master Key Read Soft Lock When set, prevents any software reads to the ZMK Registers and ZMK_ECC_VALUE field of the LPMKCR

enumeratedValues.name: READ_ALLOWED
enumeratedValues.description: Read access is allowed (only in software Programming mode)

SRTC_SL.name: SRTC_SL
SRTC_SL.description: Secure Real Time Counter Soft Lock When set, prevents any writes to the SRTC Registers, SRTC_ENV, and SRTC_INV_EN bits

LPCALB_SL.name: LPCALB_SL
LPCALB_SL.description: LP Calibration Soft Lock When set, prevents any writes to the LP Calibration Value (LPCALB_VAL) and LP Calibration Enable (LPCALB_EN)

MC_SL.name: MC_SL
MC_SL.description: Monotonic Counter Soft Lock When set, prevents any writes (increments) to the MC Registers and MC_ENV bit

GPR_SL.name: GPR_SL
GPR_SL.description: General Purpose Register Soft Lock When set, prevents any writes to the GPR

LPSVCR_SL.name: LPSVCR_SL
LPSVCR_SL.description: LP Security Violation Control Register Soft Lock When set, prevents any writes to the LPSVCR

LPSECR_SL.name: LPSECR_SL
LPSECR_SL.description: LP Security Events Configuration Register Soft Lock When set, prevents any writes to the LPSECR

MKS_SL.name: MKS_SL
MKS_SL.description: Master Key Select Soft Lock When set, prevents any writes to the MASTER_KEY_SEL field of the LPMKCR

HPSVCR_L.name: HPSVCR_L
HPSVCR_L.description: HP Security Violation Control Register Lock When set, prevents any writes to the HPSVCR

HPSICR_L.name: HPSICR_L
HPSICR_L.description: HP Security Interrupt Control Register Lock When set, prevents any writes to the HPSICR

HAC_L.name: HAC_L
HAC_L.description: High Assurance Counter Lock When set, prevents any writes to HPHACIVR, HPHACR, and HAC_EN bit of HPCOMR

SSM_ST.name: SSM_ST
SSM_ST.description: SSM State Transition Transition state of the system security monitor

SSM_ST_DIS.name: SSM_ST_DIS
SSM_ST_DIS.description: SSM Secure to Trusted State Transition Disable When set, disables the SSM transition from secure to trusted state

enumeratedValues.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValues.description: Secure to Trusted State transition is enabled

enumeratedValues.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValues.description: Secure to Trusted State transition is disabled

SSM_SFNS_DIS.name: SSM_SFNS_DIS
SSM_SFNS_DIS.description: SSM Soft Fail to Non-Secure State Transition Disable When set, it disables the SSM transition from soft fail to non-secure state

enumeratedValues.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValues.description: Soft Fail to Non-Secure State transition is enabled

enumeratedValues.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValues.description: Soft Fail to Non-Secure State transition is disabled

LP_SWR.name: LP_SWR
LP_SWR.description: LP Software Reset When set to 1, most registers in the SNVS_LP section are reset, but the following registers are not reset by an LP software reset: Monotonic Counter Secure Real Time Counter Time Alarm Register This bit cannot be set when the LP_SWR_DIS bit is set

LP_SWR_DIS.name: LP_SWR_DIS
LP_SWR_DIS.description: LP Software Reset Disable When set, disables the LP software reset

SW_SV.name: SW_SV
SW_SV.description: Software Security Violation When set, the system security monitor treats this bit as a non-fatal security violation

SW_FSV.name: SW_FSV
SW_FSV.description: Software Fatal Security Violation When set, the system security monitor treats this bit as a fatal security violation

SW_LPSV.name: SW_LPSV
SW_LPSV.description: LP Software Security Violation When set, SNVS_LP treats this bit as a security violation

PROG_ZMK.name: PROG_ZMK
PROG_ZMK.description: Program Zeroizable Master Key This bit activates ZMK hardware programming mechanism

MKS_EN.name: MKS_EN
MKS_EN.description: Master Key Select Enable When not set, the one time programmable (OTP) master key is selected by default

enumeratedValues.name: SELECT_OTP
enumeratedValues.description: OTP master key is selected as an SNVS master key

enumeratedValues.name: SELECT_PER_LPMKCR
enumeratedValues.description: SNVS master key is selected according to the setting of the MASTER_KEY_SEL field of LPMKCR

HAC_EN.name: HAC_EN
HAC_EN.description: High Assurance Counter Enable This bit controls the SSM transition from the soft fail to the hard fail state

HAC_LOAD.name: HAC_LOAD
HAC_LOAD.description: High Assurance Counter Load When set, it loads the High Assurance Counter Register with the value of the High Assurance Counter Load Register

HAC_CLEAR.name: HAC_CLEAR
HAC_CLEAR.description: High Assurance Counter Clear When set, it clears the High Assurance Counter Register

HAC_STOP.name: HAC_STOP
HAC_STOP.description: High Assurance Counter Stop This bit can be set only when SSM is in soft fail state

NPSWA_EN.name: NPSWA_EN
NPSWA_EN.description: Non-Privileged Software Access Enable When set, allows non-privileged software to access all SNVS registers, including those that are privileged software read/write access only

HPTA_EN.name: HPTA_EN
HPTA_EN.description: HP Time Alarm Enable When set, the time alarm interrupt is generated if the value in the HP Time Alarm Registers is equal to the value of the HP Real Time Counter

enumeratedValues.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValues.description: HP Time Alarm Interrupt is disabled

enumeratedValues.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValues.description: HP Time Alarm Interrupt is enabled

DIS_PI.name: DIS_PI
DIS_PI.description: Disable periodic interrupt in the functional interrupt

enumeratedValues.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValues.description: Periodic interrupt will trigger a functional interrupt

enumeratedValues.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValues.description: Disable periodic interrupt in the function interrupt

PI_EN.name: PI_EN
PI_EN.description: HP Periodic Interrupt Enable The periodic interrupt can be generated only if the HP Real Time Counter is enabled

PI_FREQ.name: PI_FREQ
PI_FREQ.description: Periodic Interrupt Frequency Defines frequency of the periodic interrupt

enumeratedValues.name: USE_BIT_0
enumeratedValues.description: - bit 0 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

enumeratedValues.name: USE_BIT_1
enumeratedValues.description: - bit 1 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

enumeratedValues.name: USE_BIT_2
enumeratedValues.description: - bit 2 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

enumeratedValues.name: USE_BIT_3
enumeratedValues.description: - bit 3 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

enumeratedValues.name: USE_BIT_4
enumeratedValues.description: - bit 4 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

enumeratedValues.name: USE_BIT_5
enumeratedValues.description: - bit 5 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

enumeratedValues.name: USE_BIT_6
enumeratedValues.description: - bit 6 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

enumeratedValues.name: USE_BIT_7
enumeratedValues.description: - bit 7 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

enumeratedValues.name: USE_BIT_8
enumeratedValues.description: - bit 8 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

enumeratedValues.name: USE_BIT_9
enumeratedValues.description: - bit 9 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

enumeratedValues.name: USE_BIT_10
enumeratedValues.description: - bit 10 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

enumeratedValues.name: USE_BIT_11
enumeratedValues.description: - bit 11 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

enumeratedValues.name: USE_BIT_12
enumeratedValues.description: - bit 12 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

enumeratedValues.name: USE_BIT_13
enumeratedValues.description: - bit 13 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

enumeratedValues.name: USE_BIT_14
enumeratedValues.description: - bit 14 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

enumeratedValues.name: USE_BIT_1r5
enumeratedValues.description: - bit 15 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

HPCALB_EN.name: HPCALB_EN
HPCALB_EN.description: HP Real Time Counter Calibration Enabled Indicates that the time calibration mechanism is enabled.

HPCALB_VAL.name: HPCALB_VAL
HPCALB_VAL.description: HP Calibration Value Defines signed calibration value for the HP Real Time Counter

enumeratedValues.name: ADD_0_PER_32768_TICKS
enumeratedValues.description: +0 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter

enumeratedValues.name: ADD_1_PER_32768_TICKS
enumeratedValues.description: +1 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter

enumeratedValues.name: ADD_2_PER_32768_TICKS
enumeratedValues.description: +2 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter

enumeratedValues.name: ADD_15_PER_32768_TICKS
enumeratedValues.description: +15 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter

enumeratedValues.name: SUB_16_PER_32768_TICKS
enumeratedValues.description: -16 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter

enumeratedValues.name: SUB_15_PER_32768_TICKS
enumeratedValues.description: -15 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter

enumeratedValues.name: SUB_2_PER_32768_TICKS
enumeratedValues.description: -2 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter

enumeratedValues.name: SUB_1_PER_32768_TICKS
enumeratedValues.description: -1 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter

enumeratedValues.name: SYNC_TIME
enumeratedValues.description: Synchronize the HP Time Counter to the LP Time Counter

SV0_EN.name: SV0_EN
SV0_EN.description: Security Violation 0 Interrupt Enable Setting this bit to 1 enables generation of the security interrupt to the host processor upon detection of the Security Violation 0 security violation

SV1_EN.name: SV1_EN
SV1_EN.description: Security Violation 1 Interrupt Enable Setting this bit to 1 enables generation of the security interrupt to the host processor upon detection of the Security Violation 1 security violation

SV2_EN.name: SV2_EN
SV2_EN.description: Security Violation 2 Interrupt Enable Setting this bit to 1 enables generation of the security interrupt to the host processor upon detection of the Security Violation 2 security violation

SV3_EN.name: SV3_EN
SV3_EN.description: Security Violation 3 Interrupt Enable Setting this bit to 1 enables generation of the security interrupt to the host processor upon detection of the Security Violation 3 security violation

SV4_EN.name: SV4_EN
SV4_EN.description: Security Violation 4 Interrupt Enable Setting this bit to 1 enables generation of the security interrupt to the host processor upon detection of the Security Violation 4 security violation

SV5_EN.name: SV5_EN
SV5_EN.description: Security Violation 5 Interrupt Enable Setting this bit to 1 enables generation of the security interrupt to the host processor upon detection of the Security Violation 5 security violation

LPSVI_EN.name: LPSVI_EN
LPSVI_EN.description: LP Security Violation Interrupt Enable This bit enables generating of the security interrupt to the host processor upon security violation signal from the LP section

enumeratedValues.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValues.description: LP Security Violation Interrupt is Disabled

enumeratedValues.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValues.description: LP Security Violation Interrupt is Enabled

SV0_CFG.name: SV0_CFG
SV0_CFG.description: Security Violation 0 Security Violation Configuration This field configures the Security Violation 0 Security Violation Input

enumeratedValues.name: NON_FATAL
enumeratedValues.description: Security Violation 0 is a non-fatal violation

enumeratedValues.name: FATAL
enumeratedValues.description: Security Violation 0 is a fatal violation

SV1_CFG.name: SV1_CFG
SV1_CFG.description: Security Violation 1 Security Violation Configuration This field configures the Security Violation 1 Security Violation Input

enumeratedValues.name: NON_FATAL
enumeratedValues.description: Security Violation 1 is a non-fatal violation

enumeratedValues.name: FATAL
enumeratedValues.description: Security Violation 1 is a fatal violation

SV2_CFG.name: SV2_CFG
SV2_CFG.description: Security Violation 2 Security Violation Configuration This field configures the Security Violation 2 Security Violation Input

enumeratedValues.name: NON_FATAL
enumeratedValues.description: Security Violation 2 is a non-fatal violation

enumeratedValues.name: FATAL
enumeratedValues.description: Security Violation 2 is a fatal violation

SV3_CFG.name: SV3_CFG
SV3_CFG.description: Security Violation 3 Security Violation Configuration This field configures the Security Violation 3 Security Violation Input

enumeratedValues.name: NON_FATAL
enumeratedValues.description: Security Violation 3 is a non-fatal violation

enumeratedValues.name: FATAL
enumeratedValues.description: Security Violation 3 is a fatal violation

SV4_CFG.name: SV4_CFG
SV4_CFG.description: Security Violation 4 Security Violation Configuration This field configures the Security Violation 4 Security Violation Input

enumeratedValues.name: NON_FATAL
enumeratedValues.description: Security Violation 4 is a non-fatal violation

enumeratedValues.name: FATAL
enumeratedValues.description: Security Violation 4 is a fatal violation

SV5_CFG.name: SV5_CFG
SV5_CFG.description: Security Violation 5 Security Violation Configuration This field configures the Security Violation 5 Security Violation Input

enumeratedValues.name: NON_FATAL
enumeratedValues.description: Security Violation 5 is a non-fatal violation

enumeratedValues.name: FATAL
enumeratedValues.description: Security Violation 5 is a fatal violation

LPSV_CFG.name: LPSV_CFG
LPSV_CFG.description: LP Security Violation Configuration This field configures the LP security violation source.

enumeratedValues.name: NON_FATAL
enumeratedValues.description: LP security violation is a non-fatal violation

enumeratedValues.name: FATAL
enumeratedValues.description: LP security violation is a fatal violation

HPTA.name: HPTA
HPTA.description: HP Time Alarm Indicates that the HP Time Alarm has occurred since this bit was last cleared.

PI.name: PI
PI.description: Periodic Interrupt Indicates that periodic interrupt has occurred since this bit was last cleared.

LPDIS.name: LPDIS
LPDIS.description: Low Power Disable If 1, the low power section has been disabled by means of an input signal to SNVS

BTN.name: BTN
BTN.description: Button Value of the BTN input

BI.name: BI
BI.description: Button Interrupt Signal ipi_snvs_btn_int_b was asserted.

SSM_STATE.name: SSM_STATE
SSM_STATE.description: System Security Monitor State This field contains the encoded state of the SSM's state machine

enumeratedValues.name: INTERMEDIATE
enumeratedValues.description: Init Intermediate (transition state between Init and Check - SSM stays in this state only one clock cycle)

SYS_SECURITY_CFG.name: SYS_SECURITY_CFG
SYS_SECURITY_CFG.description: System Security Configuration This field reflects the three security configuration inputs to SNVS

enumeratedValues.name: FAB_CONFIG
enumeratedValues.description: Fab Configuration - the default configuration of newly fabricated chips

enumeratedValues.name: OPEN_CONFIG
enumeratedValues.description: Open Configuration - the configuration after NXP-programmable fuses have been blown

enumeratedValues.name: CLOSED_CONFIG
enumeratedValues.description: Closed Configuration - the configuration after OEM-programmable fuses have been blown

enumeratedValues.name: FIELD_RETURN_CONFIG
enumeratedValues.description: Field Return Configuration - the configuration of chips that are returned to NXP for analysis

SYS_SECURE_BOOT.name: SYS_SECURE_BOOT
SYS_SECURE_BOOT.description: System Secure Boot If SYS_SECURE_BOOT is 1, the chip boots from internal ROM

OTPMK_SYNDROME.name: OTPMK_SYNDROME
OTPMK_SYNDROME.description: One Time Programmable Master Key Syndrome In the case of a single-bit error, the eight lower bits of this value indicate the bit number of error location

OTPMK_ZERO.name: OTPMK_ZERO
OTPMK_ZERO.description: One Time Programmable Master Key is Equal to Zero

ZMK_ZERO.name: ZMK_ZERO
ZMK_ZERO.description: Zeroizable Master Key is Equal to Zero

SV0.name: SV0
SV0.description: Security Violation 0 security violation was detected.

enumeratedValues.name: NOREPORT
enumeratedValues.description: No Security Violation 0 security violation was detected.

enumeratedValues.name: REPORTED
enumeratedValues.description: Security Violation 0 security violation was detected.

SV1.name: SV1
SV1.description: Security Violation 1 security violation was detected.

enumeratedValues.name: NOREPORT
enumeratedValues.description: No Security Violation 1 security violation was detected.

enumeratedValues.name: REPORTED
enumeratedValues.description: Security Violation 1 security violation was detected.

SV2.name: SV2
SV2.description: Security Violation 2 security violation was detected.

enumeratedValues.name: NOREPORT
enumeratedValues.description: No Security Violation 2 security violation was detected.

enumeratedValues.name: REPORTED
enumeratedValues.description: Security Violation 2 security violation was detected.

SV3.name: SV3
SV3.description: Security Violation 3 security violation was detected.

enumeratedValues.name: NOREPORT
enumeratedValues.description: No Security Violation 3 security violation was detected.

enumeratedValues.name: REPORTED
enumeratedValues.description: Security Violation 3 security violation was detected.

SV4.name: SV4
SV4.description: Security Violation 4 security violation was detected.

enumeratedValues.name: NOREPORT
enumeratedValues.description: No Security Violation 4 security violation was detected.

enumeratedValues.name: REPORTED
enumeratedValues.description: Security Violation 4 security violation was detected.

SV5.name: SV5
SV5.description: Security Violation 5 security violation was detected.

enumeratedValues.name: NOREPORT
enumeratedValues.description: No Security Violation 5 security violation was detected.

enumeratedValues.name: REPORTED
enumeratedValues.description: Security Violation 5 security violation was detected.

SW_SV.name: SW_SV
SW_SV.description: Software Security Violation This bit is a read-only copy of the SW_SV bit in the HP Command Register

SW_FSV.name: SW_FSV
SW_FSV.description: Software Fatal Security Violation This bit is a read-only copy of the SW_FSV bit in the HP Command Register

SW_LPSV.name: SW_LPSV
SW_LPSV.description: LP Software Security Violation This bit is a read-only copy of the SW_LPSV bit in the HP Command Register

ZMK_SYNDROME.name: ZMK_SYNDROME
ZMK_SYNDROME.description: Zeroizable Master Key Syndrome The ZMK syndrome indicates the single-bit error location and parity for the ZMK register

ZMK_ECC_FAIL.name: ZMK_ECC_FAIL
ZMK_ECC_FAIL.description: Zeroizable Master Key Error Correcting Code Check Failure When set, this bit triggers a bad key violation to the SSM and a security violation to the SNVS_LP section, which clears security sensitive data

enumeratedValues.name: NOREPORT
enumeratedValues.description: ZMK ECC Failure was not detected.

LP_SEC_VIO.name: LP_SEC_VIO
LP_SEC_VIO.description: LP Security Violation A security volation was detected in the SNVS low power section

HPHACIVR.name: HPHACIVR
HPHACIVR.description: SNVS_HP High Assurance Counter IV Register

HAC_COUNTER_IV.name: HAC_COUNTER_IV
HAC_COUNTER_IV.description: High Assurance Counter Initial Value This register is used to set the starting count value to the high assurance counter

HAC_COUNTER.name: HAC_COUNTER
HAC_COUNTER.description: High Assurance Counter When the HAC_EN bit is set and the SSM is in the soft fail state, this counter starts to count down with the system clock

HPRTCMR.name: HPRTCMR
HPRTCMR.description: SNVS_HP Real Time Counter MSB Register

RTC.name: RTC
RTC.description: HP Real Time Counter The most-significant 15 bits of the RTC

HPRTCLR.name: HPRTCLR
HPRTCLR.description: SNVS_HP Real Time Counter LSB Register

RTC.name: RTC
RTC.description: HP Real Time Counter least-significant 32 bits

ZMK_WHL.name: ZMK_WHL
ZMK_WHL.description: Zeroizable Master Key Write Hard Lock When set, prevents any writes (software and hardware) to the ZMK registers and ZMK_HWP, ZMK_VAL, and ZMK_ECC_EN fields of the LPMKCR

ZMK_RHL.name: ZMK_RHL
ZMK_RHL.description: Zeroizable Master Key Read Hard Lock When set, prevents any software reads to the ZMK registers and ZMK_ECC_VALUE field of the LPMKCR

enumeratedValues.name: READ_ACCESS_ALLOWED
enumeratedValues.description: Read access is allowed (only in software programming mode).

SRTC_HL.name: SRTC_HL
SRTC_HL.description: Secure Real Time Counter Hard Lock When set, prevents any writes to the SRTC registers, SRTC_ENV, and SRTC_INV_EN bits

LPCALB_HL.name: LPCALB_HL
LPCALB_HL.description: LP Calibration Hard Lock When set, prevents any writes to the LP Calibration Value (LPCALB_VAL) and LP Calibration Enable (LPCALB_EN)

MC_HL.name: MC_HL
MC_HL.description: Monotonic Counter Hard Lock When set, prevents any writes (increments) to the MC Registers and MC_ENV bit

GPR_HL.name: GPR_HL
GPR_HL.description: General Purpose Register Hard Lock When set, prevents any writes to the GPR

LPSVCR_HL.name: LPSVCR_HL
LPSVCR_HL.description: LP Security Violation Control Register Hard Lock When set, prevents any writes to the LPSVCR

LPSECR_HL.name: LPSECR_HL
LPSECR_HL.description: LP Security Events Configuration Register Hard Lock When set, prevents any writes to the LPSECR

MKS_HL.name: MKS_HL
MKS_HL.description: Master Key Select Hard Lock When set, prevents any writes to the MASTER_KEY_SEL field of the LP Master Key Control Register

SRTC_ENV.name: SRTC_ENV
SRTC_ENV.description: Secure Real Time Counter Enabled and Valid When set, the SRTC becomes operational

LPTA_EN.name: LPTA_EN
LPTA_EN.description: LP Time Alarm Enable When set, the SNVS functional interrupt is asserted if the LP Time Alarm Register is equal to the 32 MSBs of the secure real time counter

enumeratedValues.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValues.description: LP time alarm interrupt is disabled.

enumeratedValues.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValues.description: LP time alarm interrupt is enabled.

MC_ENV.name: MC_ENV
MC_ENV.description: Monotonic Counter Enabled and Valid When set, the MC can be incremented (by write transaction to the LPSMCMR or LPSMCLR)

LPWUI_EN.name: LPWUI_EN
LPWUI_EN.description: LP Wake-Up Interrupt Enable This interrupt line should be connected to the external pin and is intended to inform the external chip about an SNVS_LP event (MC rollover, SRTC rollover, or time alarm )

SRTC_INV_EN.name: SRTC_INV_EN
SRTC_INV_EN.description: If this bit is 1, in the case of a security violation the SRTC stops counting and the SRTC is invalidated (SRTC_ENV bit is cleared)

enumeratedValues.name: KEEP_VALID
enumeratedValues.description: SRTC stays valid in the case of security violation (other than a software violation (HPSVSR[SW_LPSV] = 1 or HPCOMR[SW_LPSV] = 1)).

enumeratedValues.name: INVALIDATE
enumeratedValues.description: SRTC is invalidated in the case of security violation.

DP_EN.name: DP_EN
DP_EN.description: Dumb PMIC Enabled When set, software can control the system power

TOP.name: TOP
TOP.description: Turn off System Power Asserting this bit causes a signal to be sent to the Power Management IC to turn off the system power

LVD_EN.name: LVD_EN
LVD_EN.description: Digital Low-Voltage Event Enable By default the detection of a low-voltage event does not cause the pmic_en_b signal to be asserted

LPCALB_EN.name: LPCALB_EN
LPCALB_EN.description: LP Calibration Enable When set, enables the SRTC calibration mechanism

LPCALB_VAL.name: LPCALB_VAL
LPCALB_VAL.description: LP Calibration Value Defines signed calibration value for SRTC

enumeratedValues.name: ADD_0_PER_32768_TICKS
enumeratedValues.description: +0 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter clock

enumeratedValues.name: ADD_1_PER_32768_TICKS
enumeratedValues.description: +1 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter clock

enumeratedValues.name: ADD_2_PER_32768_TICKS
enumeratedValues.description: +2 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter clock

enumeratedValues.name: ADD_15_PER_32768_TICKS
enumeratedValues.description: +15 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter clock

enumeratedValues.name: SUB_16_PER_32768_TICKS
enumeratedValues.description: -16 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter clock

enumeratedValues.name: SUB_15_PER_32768_TICKS
enumeratedValues.description: -15 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter clock

enumeratedValues.name: SUB_2_PER_32768_TICKS
enumeratedValues.description: -2 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter clock

enumeratedValues.name: SUB_1_PER_32768_TICKS
enumeratedValues.description: -1 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter clock

BTN_PRESS_TIME.name: BTN_PRESS_TIME
BTN_PRESS_TIME.description: This field configures the button press time out values for the PMIC Logic

DEBOUNCE.name: DEBOUNCE
DEBOUNCE.description: This field configures the amount of debounce time for the BTN input signal

ON_TIME.name: ON_TIME
ON_TIME.description: The ON_TIME field is used to configure the period of time after BTN is asserted before pmic_en_b is asserted to turn on the SoC power

PK_EN.name: PK_EN
PK_EN.description: PMIC On Request Enable The value written to PK_EN will be asserted on output signal snvs_lp_pk_en

PK_OVERRIDE.name: PK_OVERRIDE
PK_OVERRIDE.description: PMIC On Request Override The value written to PK_OVERRIDE will be asserted on output signal snvs_lp_pk_override

MASTER_KEY_SEL.name: MASTER_KEY_SEL
MASTER_KEY_SEL.description: Master Key Select These bits select the SNVS Master Key output when Master Key Select bits are enabled by MKS_EN bit in the HPCOMR

enumeratedValues.name: SELECT_OTPMK
enumeratedValues.description: Select one time programmable master key.

enumeratedValues.name: SELECT_ZMK
enumeratedValues.description: Select zeroizable master key when MKS_EN bit is set .

enumeratedValues.name: SELECT_COMBO
enumeratedValues.description: Select combined master key when MKS_EN bit is set .

ZMK_HWP.name: ZMK_HWP
ZMK_HWP.description: Zeroizable Master Key hardware Programming mode When set, only the hardware key programming mechanism can set the ZMK and software cannot read it

enumeratedValues.name: SW_PROG_MODE
enumeratedValues.description: ZMK is in the software programming mode.

enumeratedValues.name: HW_PROG_MODE
enumeratedValues.description: ZMK is in the hardware programming mode.

ZMK_VAL.name: ZMK_VAL
ZMK_VAL.description: Zeroizable Master Key Valid When set, the ZMK value can be selected by the master key control block for use by cryptographic modules

ZMK_ECC_EN.name: ZMK_ECC_EN
ZMK_ECC_EN.description: Zeroizable Master Key Error Correcting Code Check Enable Writing one to this field automatically calculates and sets the ZMK ECC value in the ZMK_ECC_VALUE field of this register

ZMK_ECC_VALUE.name: ZMK_ECC_VALUE
ZMK_ECC_VALUE.description: Zeroizable Master Key Error Correcting Code Value This field is automatically calculated and set when one is written into ZMK_ECC_EN bit of this register

SV0_EN.name: SV0_EN
SV0_EN.description: Security Violation 0 Enable This bit enables Security Violation 0 Input

enumeratedValues.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValues.description: Security Violation 0 is disabled in the LP domain.

enumeratedValues.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValues.description: Security Violation 0 is enabled in the LP domain.

SV1_EN.name: SV1_EN
SV1_EN.description: Security Violation 1 Enable This bit enables Security Violation 1 Input

enumeratedValues.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValues.description: Security Violation 1 is disabled in the LP domain.

enumeratedValues.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValues.description: Security Violation 1 is enabled in the LP domain.

SV2_EN.name: SV2_EN
SV2_EN.description: Security Violation 2 Enable This bit enables Security Violation 2 Input

enumeratedValues.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValues.description: Security Violation 2 is disabled in the LP domain.

enumeratedValues.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValues.description: Security Violation 2 is enabled in the LP domain.

SV3_EN.name: SV3_EN
SV3_EN.description: Security Violation 3 Enable This bit enables Security Violation 3 Input

enumeratedValues.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValues.description: Security Violation 3 is disabled in the LP domain.

enumeratedValues.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValues.description: Security Violation 3 is enabled in the LP domain.

SV4_EN.name: SV4_EN
SV4_EN.description: Security Violation 4 Enable This bit enables Security Violation 4 Input

enumeratedValues.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValues.description: Security Violation 4 is disabled in the LP domain.

enumeratedValues.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValues.description: Security Violation 4 is enabled in the LP domain.

SV5_EN.name: SV5_EN
SV5_EN.description: Security Violation 5 Enable This bit enables Security Violation 5 Input

enumeratedValues.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValues.description: Security Violation 5 is disabled in the LP domain.

enumeratedValues.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValues.description: Security Violation 5 is enabled in the LP domain.

SRTCR_EN.name: SRTCR_EN
SRTCR_EN.description: SRTC Rollover Enable When set, an SRTC rollover event generates an LP security violation.

MCR_EN.name: MCR_EN
MCR_EN.description: MC Rollover Enable When set, an MC Rollover event generates an LP security violation.

PFD_OBSERV.name: PFD_OBSERV
PFD_OBSERV.description: System Power Fail Detector (PFD) Observability Flop The asynchronous reset input of this flop is connected directly to the inverted output of the PFD analog circuitry (external to the SNVS block)

POR_OBSERV.name: POR_OBSERV
POR_OBSERV.description: Power On Reset (POR) Observability Flop The asynchronous reset input of this flop is connected directly to the output of the POR analog circuitry (external to the SNVS

LTDC.name: LTDC
LTDC.description: Low Temp Detect Configuration These configuration bits are wired as an output of the module.

HTDC.name: HTDC
HTDC.description: High Temperature Detect Configuration These configuration bits are wired as an output of the module

VRC.name: VRC
VRC.description: Voltage Reference Configuration These configuration bits are wired as an output of the module.

OSCB.name: OSCB
OSCB.description: Oscillator Bypass When OSCB=1 the osc_bypass signal is asserted

enumeratedValues.name: NOT_BYPASSED
enumeratedValues.description: Normal SRTC clock oscillator not bypassed.

enumeratedValues.name: BYPASSED
enumeratedValues.description: Normal SRTC clock oscillator bypassed. Alternate clock can drive the SRTC clock source.

enumeratedValues.name: NOREPORT
enumeratedValues.description: SRTC has not reached its maximum value.

enumeratedValues.name: REPORTED
enumeratedValues.description: SRTC has reached its maximum value.

enumeratedValues.name: NOREPORT
enumeratedValues.description: MC has not reached its maximum value.

enumeratedValues.name: REPORTED
enumeratedValues.description: MC has reached its maximum value.

ESVD.name: ESVD
ESVD.description: External Security Violation Detected Indicates that a security violation is detected on one of the HP security violation ports

EO.name: EO
EO.description: Emergency Off This bit is set when a power off is requested.

SPOF.name: SPOF
SPOF.description: Set Power Off The SPO bit is set when the power button is pressed longer than the configured debounce time

enumeratedValues.name: NOREPORT
enumeratedValues.description: Set Power Off was not detected.

SPON.name: SPON
SPON.description: Set Power On The SPON bit is set when the set_pwr_on_irq interrupt is triggered, which happens when the power button is pressed longer than the configured debounce time

enumeratedValues.name: NOREPORT
enumeratedValues.description: Set Power On Interrupt was not detected.

enumeratedValues.name: REPORTED
enumeratedValues.description: Set Power On Interrupt was detected.

LPNS.name: LPNS
LPNS.description: LP Section is Non-Secured Indicates that LP section was provisioned/programmed in the non-secure state

enumeratedValues.name: NOT_PRGRMD_IN_NON_SECURE_STATE
enumeratedValues.description: LP section was not programmed in the non-secure state.

enumeratedValues.name: WAS_PRGRMD_IN_NON_SECURE_STATE
enumeratedValues.description: LP section was programmed in the non-secure state.

LPS.name: LPS
LPS.description: LP Section is Secured Indicates that the LP section is provisioned/programmed in the secure or trusted state

enumeratedValues.name: NOT_PRGRMD_IN_SECURE_OR_TRUSTED_STATE
enumeratedValues.description: LP section was not programmed in secure or trusted state.

enumeratedValues.name: WAS_PRGRMD_IN_SECURE_OR_TRUSTED_STATE
enumeratedValues.description: LP section was programmed in secure or trusted state.

LPSRTCMR.name: LPSRTCMR
LPSRTCMR.description: SNVS_LP Secure Real Time Counter MSB Register

SRTC.name: SRTC
SRTC.description: LP Secure Real Time Counter The most-significant 15 bits of the SRTC

LPSRTCLR.name: LPSRTCLR
LPSRTCLR.description: SNVS_LP Secure Real Time Counter LSB Register

SRTC.name: SRTC
SRTC.description: LP Secure Real Time Counter least-significant 32 bits This register can be programmed only when SRTC is not active and not locked, meaning the SRTC_ENV, SRTC_SL, and SRTC_HL bits are not set

LPTA.name: LPTA
LPTA.description: LP Time Alarm This register can be programmed only when the LP time alarm is disabled (LPTA_EN bit is not set)

LPSMCMR.name: LPSMCMR
LPSMCMR.description: SNVS_LP Secure Monotonic Counter MSB Register

MON_COUNTER.name: MON_COUNTER
MON_COUNTER.description: Monotonic Counter most-significant 16 Bits Note that writing to this register does not change the value of this field to the value that was written

MC_ERA_BITS.name: MC_ERA_BITS
MC_ERA_BITS.description: Monotonic Counter Era Bits These bits are inputs to the module and typically connect to fuses

LPSMCLR.name: LPSMCLR
LPSMCLR.description: SNVS_LP Secure Monotonic Counter LSB Register

MON_COUNTER.name: MON_COUNTER
MON_COUNTER.description: Monotonic Counter bits Note that writing to this register does not change the value of this field to the value that was written

GPR.name: GPR
GPR.description: General Purpose Register When GPR_SL or GPR_HL bit is set, the register cannot be programmed.

ZMK.name: ZMK
ZMK.description: Zeroizable Master Key Each of these registers contains 32 bits of the 256-bit ZMK value

GPR.name: GPR
GPR.description: General Purpose Register When GPR_SL or GPR_HL bit is set, the register cannot be programmed.

GPR.name: GPR
GPR.description: General Purpose Register When GPR_SL or GPR_HL bit is set, the register cannot be programmed.

IP_ERA.name: IP_ERA
IP_ERA.description: IP Era 00h - Era 1 or 2 03h - Era 3 04h - Era 4 05h - Era 5 06h - Era 6
